header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.conv_type: discussing, explaining, inquiring, complaining, announcing, anecdote telling

body.u: basically I was in French by myself because we were really early from assembly and I was sat there
in the mobile?
yeah and there was two classrooms
mm
and then came in there and she was like like that and I was like hi
cos I don't like waving to people
what was she in the class opposite?
I think so but she was standing in like the little lobby bit with
what were you just sitting down on your own?
well no because like and were sat over there and there was like me and on this table
oh

and then I was just looking at the door and she was there and I was like she was like and I was like and I was just calm wave at me like one time I was walking to school and waved at me and I didn't wave back
oh

she waved at me and I was just like mm and she sort of smiled and but we were on the other side of the street so it's really awkward it wasn't really like waving distance cos you know when you're really close to someone
mm
and you wave?
and when it's really far away you can't tell if they're waving at you
yeah
or someone else in your direction
and that's really depressing when they're waving at someone behind you and you're like
you turn around mm mm when we talk in maths and always thinks that you're talking to him
yeah he's like what? and I'm like not talking to you
yeah

yeah but I don't understand because I'm not actually looking at him like he's there and I'm looking past him like he can't he see that cos if I was talking to you and I just kind of started yeah so how how do you like isn't that just weird?
yeah
I don't understand
cos you're not even looking at him

and I'm not having a conversation that I would be I'm like yeah hi and he's like I didn't say anything and I'm like yes cos cos I'm not talking to you I'm talking past you and then everyone on that table is like what?
I really didn't get that thing in maths when she was saying that the exact dancer thing she's so annoying
I know and then she was like I really don't understand why I bother teaching half the people in here and I was like ha ha
well
she always says this to me cos I'm just sitting there
then don't be a teacher
and I'm just like ha ha ha ha
she's so annoying
and then I'm like and then she's like about to tell everyone off and I'm like Miss can I just can I just go to the toilet now?

cos she was like I was like can I go to the toilet? and she was like no I was like why? and she was like well you've just had the whole of lunch and I was like yeah but I didn't need to go at lunch and she was like what so you've just had the sudden urge to go when you were walking up here? and I was like yeah and then she was like oh as I was sitting there doing that sheet I was like I really need a wee
and then I finished and I was like Miss I'm finished can I go? and then you didn't even notice me leave
yeah sorry
I walked right past you I looked at you and you were just like oh my god you're sitting in front of me
and I was just like oh alright then
yeah probably cos is so funny

oh my gosh and then today in English she goes I can't read like well yeah you're the one that said that you read like half a page in nine seconds so like that would never happen and she literally went
yeah and then how it goes seven eight nine ten eleven
yeah
seconds

how can you read that fast? you can't read that fast

that's stupid

yeah

like she chickened out just shove it in my pocket
because what I would have done is put it in my pocket and she'd be like no give it
and be like give me a go

and be like fine then and give her the old one like what's the point of just being like cos if she's like give it to me then she could just be like like that and then she'd be like give it to me and then you'd be like
yeah and then give the old phone that that's really a good idea
that is a good idea
if you actually do it yeah
but then what if they see like you that you've got an Iphone six and you hand over an Iphone four?
mm don't wanna
that's not
and then but my Iphone four is dead maybe I should just bring my Iphone four to school? yeah but I completely forgot we weren't allowed to use it like in between lessons
yeah
and so she was like you put your phone away and she completely seen me but she didn't know my name so I was just like alright then
well why does yeah why does she always know my name why does she always call me ?
yeah it's cos you're like the famous the maths girl
yeah she doesn't know
no I'm sure she does cos I'm sure all the teachers were in a room and they were like hurray for distinction
yeah
and I'm sure it was cos I'm sure they were all like clapping it was like well we were all cheering for you and I'm like what in the staffroom?
so embarrassing
and like every teacher came up to you and was like here's your class paper
yeah all she had said like how was I supposed to know that I did well on that?
yeah they were like well done in the maths and you were like
because I was like because it was like twenty out of fifty and it was like how is that good?
yeah cos she just goes your results well done
yeah
and then I was like congratulations and you were like er what? and was like
I was like I got twenty
so you know you got a distinction? and you were like actually no and every time comes up to you I'm next to you standing there really awkwardly like I actually am in top set maths
I need to get email do you know what it is?
yeah
what?
oh okay cos my dad needs to email him
well I think it's
yeah

it's quite a hard one for spelling

do you want some more water?

we need to practise you need to practise your pronunciation and she was like right okay everyone after me and she said the sentence and
yeah
nobody said anything and we were all just like
mm

and we were like and she was like come on guys you're not gonna get better unless you open your mouths and we were all like
and she was like
like
yeah and she goes
open your mouth

right okay come on je me and we were all like je mm and she's like dispu depuis or whatever it is and we're like dispu and she's like and then she comes up to me and cos I was standing next to like writing this thing and she goes
yeah

this one's a bit tricky this word right okay ready repeat after me and she made us just us two like repeat this word and she was like corvee en Normand or whatever it was and we were just like corvee and she was like perfect like thanks

neither do I in French it's really hard she's like hah like the lady outside was like erm peron and I was like parent and she was like peron and I was like parent and she was like no parent and I was like hah on
is that the lady with the short hair?
yeah yeah
she's really annoying
and then she goes to she goes very good very good cos it was really awkward cos we had to go out in pairs and me and were there and she and she was like very good
good as in ?
yeah and and then she was just like to me she was like
actually there's no other any more is there?
no she was goes to me she asked me she goes what do your parents do? and I go oh yeah my mum works in a library my dad is a teacher
is this in French or English?
yeah and she goes what school does he teach in? in French
yeah

and I go oh he doesn't teach in a school like in English and she goes well just make it up and I was like oh okay and then afterwards she goes you need to be able to understand the question I was like I did understand the question I said he doesn't teach in a school and she was like yeah but you don't understand the question and I was like no no I did understand the question and she was like you need to be able to understand the question but I I understood the question
what so you said he was a teacher and she?

she goes what school? and I go he doesn't teach at any schools and she goes well just understand the question answer the question and I'm like what? but she but she's kinda hard to understand cos her English isn't that great and she's just like I'm
yeah
I'm confusing for you now and 's like what?
what?
we need to go in five minutes yay lucky you actually
but 's not even coming though
seven minutes
I'm just gonna have an hour lesson by myself actually that was probably
did you manage to find ?
well you did tell me to tell her
were you supposed to?
oh right and she's not gonna be checking her emails nobody checks their emails like he emails
but I can remember that one time when I checked my emails and there was that my old buddy in year seven? she was like oh do you remember me? and then I replied and then she replied back
and then did you reply back after that?
yeah
and then did she reply after that?
I don't know I haven't check my emails
well the one time he emailed you was like well cos I turned up for my lesson and he wasn't there and then like
yeah
three months later in business I checked my emails and it was like dear parents to my email address dear parents I'm very sorry to say that I've broken my leg so there'll be no lessons this week
has he got hold of your parents' email?
yeah he has my parents' email like
tell him to tell him today that you never check your emails and then
but he just but he never sends emails he never sends us emails it was lucky I had my clarinet and he's like sorry I can't do tomorrow
why did you bring your clarinet?
I just left it yesterday cos I had to use it today
did you not need to practise?
I did think about that when I got home cos I was gonna get my old clarinet out and then I was like no I can't be bothered
have you even actually practised this week?
I practised on Sunday
and was that it?
well yeah because I couldn't practise Monday morning took it to jazz band
yeah but what about Thursday Friday Saturday Sunday?
what of last week?
yeah well like between last Wednesday and today?
I have practised but not my scales cos scales are boring
yeah

and I don't practise them I just wing it like he goes right okay so you really the scales need to be your the main focus of your practise this week and I go okay and then just play loads of pieces that he doesn't even want me to play like this one piece I could never play and we gave up on it cos he was like no you can't play this in your grade you're not good enough and I still play it I keep playing it and I'm just like yeah you know
but not your piece that you're supposed to play on your own?

no I mean I've played all of that and but then he goes one like literally I played my the really long piece probably the worst I've ever played it like I used to be able to play it really well last week
oh that's the same with mine my like the more you practise
as I practise I get worse yeah
the worse you get and it just sounds really sloppy and like
yeah and cos I had a tough reed on I had to take a breath like every bar and probably the worst I've ever played it in my life and then he goes yeah that was really good and I was like
really?
really? so I'd rather he'd be more honest with me and be like look yeah
it probably was really good
no but it wasn't like I literally had to take a breath every bar and I had to restart it like three times
well it's a good job you don't have who always shouts at you when you take a breath or when you don't take a breath like last lesson she I didn't take a breath
yeah
and then she shouted at me for not taking breaths and then I took a breath and she was like you have to stop taking breaths there
you've just told me I had to
